page.title: 01GAZATEER
page.content: This 4x 3 Km. grid is a rural area in the south east of Hampshire to the east of the River Meon. Approximately half the grid is in Newtown parish, part of the civil parish of Soberton. The remainder is shared by Hambledon, Denmead, North Boarhunt and a small part of Southwick. For convenience we have called it Newtown area. The north east corner is on Upper Chalk with gravel deposits. A band of Reading beds runs through the area but about half is London Clay. There is a stream with its associated gravel and alluvium running north to south. Most of the clay beds were originally forested and a large proportion is still wooded with the Forestry Commission owning about one sixth of our block. Traditionally Portsmouth is the city which this area turns to.
